abstracts.cdata!:
The loan would support, in respect to
            exports: (i) improved access by exporters to duty/tax free
            imported inputs through changes in the standard rebate
            system and the introduction of open bonded manufacturing;
            (ii) improvements in export incentives by use of domestic
            letter of credit as means of identifying indirect exporters;
            (iii) improvements in the export credit guarantee scheme and
            collateral practices of banks regarding small exporters and
            exporters of non-traditional exports; and (iv) strengthening
            of institutions to support exports. In the area of trade
            policy the loan would support: (i) studies of the impacts of
            liberalization programs in key industries on production,
            government revenues, together with the preparation of
            subsector adjustment programs; (ii) the institutionalization
            of policymaking on trade reform; and (iii) commitments not
            to expand coverage of import bans, to monitor protection
            implicit in existing bans and to eliminate import bans on
            products which have export potential. In the area of
            domestic industrial policy, the loan would support: (i)
            deregulation of the edible oils industry; and (ii)
            divestiture of a portion of government holdings in a number
            of public enterprises.
